Provision.Text: Whereas the Governor in Council is of the opinion that the actions of the Russian Federation constitute a grave breach of international peace and security that has resulted or is likely to result in a serious international crisis;

Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs, pursuant to subsections 4(1) to (3) of the Special Economic Measures Acta, makes the annexed Special Economic Measures (Russia) Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: consumer communication device means any of the following items:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: computers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: disk drives, solid-state storage equipment and other memory devices;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: input/output control units, other than industrial controllers designed for chemical processing;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: graphics accelerators and graphics coprocessors;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: monitors;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: printers;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: modems, network access controllers and communications channel controllers;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: keyboards, mice and similar devices;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: mobile phones, including cellular and satellite telephones, personal digital assistants, subscriber identity module (SIM) cards and similar devices;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: information security equipment and peripherals;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: digital cameras and memory cards;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: television and radio receivers;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: recording devices;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: batteries, chargers, carrying cases and accessories for a good referred to in paragraphs (a) to (m); and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: software, other than encryption source code, for use with a good referred to in paragraphs (a) to (n). (dispositif de communication)

Definition.Text: designated person means a person who is in Russia, or is a national of Russia who does not ordinarily reside in Canada, and whose name is listed in either one of Schedules 1, 2 or 3. (personne désignée)
Minister means the Minister of Foreign Affairs. (ministre)

Restricted Goods and Technologies List means the Restricted Goods and Technologies List, prepared by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development and published on the Department’s website, as amended from time to time. (Liste des marchandises et technologies réglementées)
Russia means the Russian Federation and includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any political subdivision of the Russian Federation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the government, and any department, of the Russian Federation or of a political subdivision of the Russian Federation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any agency of the Russian Federation or of a political subdivision of the Russian Federation. (Russie)

Definition.Text: technology means any form of technical data or technical assistance, such as providing instruction, training, consulting or technical advice services or transferring know-how or technical data. (technologie)

Section.Text: A person whose name is listed in Schedule 1 is a person in respect of whom the Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person engaged in activities that directly or indirectly facilitate, support, provide funding for or contribute to a violation or attempted violation of the sovereignty or territorial integrity of Ukraine or that obstruct the work of international organizations in Ukraine;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has participated in gross and systematic human rights violations in Russia;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a former or current senior official of the Government of Russia;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an associate of a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (b);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c) and (g);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned, held or controlled, directly or indirectly, by a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d) or acting on behalf of or at the direction of such a person;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned, held or controlled, directly or indirectly, by Russia or acting on behalf of or at the direction of Russia; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a senior official of an entity referred to in paragraph (e) or (f).

Section.Text: A person whose name is listed in Schedule 2 or 3 is a person in respect of whom the Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned, held or controlled, directly or indirectly, by a person referred to in any of paragraphs 2(a) to (b) or acting on behalf of or at the direction of a person referred to in any of those paragraphs; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned, held or controlled, directly or indirectly, by Russia or acting on behalf of or at the direction of Russia.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: deal in any property, wherever situated, that is owned, held or controlled by or on behalf of a designated person whose name is listed in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter into or facilitate, directly or indirectly, any transaction related to a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or other related service in respect of a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: make available any goods, wherever situated, to a designated person listed in Schedule 1 or to a person acting on their behalf; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or related service to or for the benefit of a designated person listed in Schedule 1.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to transact in, provide financing for or otherwise deal in new debt of longer than 30 days’ maturity, including bonds, loans, debentures, extensions of credit, loan guarantees, letters of credit, bank drafts, bankers’ acceptances, discount notes, treasury bills, commercial paper and other similar instruments, in relation to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a designated person listed in Schedule 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the property of a designated person listed in Schedule 2; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the interests or rights in property of a designated person listed in Schedule 2.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to transact in, provide financing for or otherwise deal in new debt of longer than 90 days’ maturity, including bonds, loans, debentures, extensions of credit, loan guarantees, letters of credit, bank drafts, bankers’ acceptances, discount notes, treasury bills, commercial paper and other similar instruments, in relation to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a designated person listed in Schedule 3;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the property of a designated person listed in Schedule 3; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the interests or rights in property of a designated person listed in Schedule 3.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) and (1.1) do not apply if the activities referred to in those subsections were undertaken before the designated person was listed in Schedule 2 or 3.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to transact in, provide financing for or otherwise deal in new securities, including shares or any other ownership interest, in relation to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a designated person listed in Schedule 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the property of a designated person listed in Schedule 2; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the interests or rights in property of a designated person listed in Schedule 2.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply if the activities referred to in that subsection were undertaken before the designated person was listed in Schedule 2.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to export, sell, supply or ship any good referred to in column 1 of Schedule 4, wherever situated, to Russia or to any person in Russia for use in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: offshore oil exploration or production at a depth greater than 500 m;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: oil exploration or production in the Arctic; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shale oil exploration or production.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to provide to Russia or to any person in Russia any financial, technical or other services related to any good whose export, sale, supply or shipment is prohibited by subsection (1).

Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to goods or services if a contract for the export, sale, supply or shipment of the good or for any related service set out in subsection (2) is entered into before the day on which this section comes into force.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person to dock in Canada or pass through Canada any ship that is registered in Russia or used, leased or chartered, in whole or in part, by or on behalf of or for the benefit of Russia, a person in Russia or a designated person, unless such docking or passage is necessary to safeguard human life or to ensure navigational safety.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to import, purchase or acquire any good referred to in column 1 of Schedule 5, wherever situated, from Russia or from any person in Russia.
Subsection (1) does not apply to goods if a contract for the import, purchase or acquisition of the good is entered into before the day on which this section comes into force.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to export, sell, supply or ship any good, wherever situated, to Russia or to any person in Russia if the good is referred to in the Restricted Goods and Technologies List or in Schedule 5.1.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to provide to Russia or to any person in Russia any technology that is referred to in the Restricted Goods and Technologies List or in Schedule 5.1.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: goods temporarily exported for use by a representative of the media from Canada or from a partner country that is listed in Annex 1 to the Restricted Goods and Technologies List;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use in support of international nuclear safeguards verifications;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use by a department or agency of the Government of Canada or of a partner country that is listed in Annex 1 to the Restricted Goods and Technologies List;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use in inspections under the Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on their Destruction, signed at Paris, France on January 13, 1993, as amended from time to time;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use in relation to the activities of the International Space Station;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: software updates for an end-user that is a civilian entity that is owned, held or controlled by a Canadian or a national of a partner country that is listed in Annex 1 to the Restricted Goods and Technologies List, or a subsidiary of such an entity;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: civil aircraft registered in a foreign state that are departing from Canada after a temporary sojourn in Canada or civil aircraft registered in Canada departing for a temporary sojourn abroad;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the following goods, if stored on board an aircraft or ship:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: equipment and spare parts that are necessary for the proper operation of the aircraft or ship, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: usual and reasonable quantities of supplies intended for consumption on board the aircraft or ship during the outgoing and return flight or voyage;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: goods exported for use or consumption on an aircraft or ship that is registered in Canada or the United States;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: goods exported by an air carrier that is owned by a Canadian or a national of the United States for use in the maintenance, repair or operation of an aircraft registered in Canada or the United States;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: consumer communication devices that are generally available to the public and designed to be installed by the user without further substantial support; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: personal effects exported by an individual that are solely for the use of the individual or the individual’s immediate family and are not intended for sale or to remain in Russia unless consumed there.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (2) does not apply to technology provided in relation to a good if the export, sale, supply or shipment of that good is authorized by subsection (3).

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to provide insurance or reinsurance to or for the benefit of Russia or any person in Russia in relation to any good described in Chapter 88 of the Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding System, published by the World Customs Organization, or in relation to technology for a good described in that chapter.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of existing insurance or reinsurance until 30 days after the day on which this section comes into force.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to export, sell, supply or ship any good referred to in column 1 of Part 1 to Schedule 6, wherever situated, to Russia or to any person in Russia.
Subsection (1) does not apply to personal effects that are taken by an individual leaving Canada for Russia that are solely for the use of the individual or the individual’s immediate family.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to import, purchase or acquire any good referred to in column 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 6, wherever situated, from Russia or from any person in Russia.
Subsection (3) does not apply to personal effects that are taken by an individual leaving Russia that are solely for the use of the individual or the individual’s immediate family.
Subsections (1) and (3) take effect 60 days after they come into force.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to export, sell, supply or ship any good referred to in column 1 of Schedule 7, wherever situated, to Russia or to any person in Russia.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: goods temporarily exported for use by a representative of the media from Canada or from a partner country that is listed in Annex 1 to the Restricted Goods and Technologies List;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use in support of international nuclear safeguards verifications;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use by a department or agency of the Government of Canada or of a partner country that is listed in Annex 1 to the Restricted Goods and Technologies List;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use in inspections under the Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on their Destruction, signed at Paris, France on January 13, 1993, as amended from time to time;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: goods for use in relation to the activities of the International Space Station;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: software updates for an end-user that is a civilian entity that is owned, held or controlled by a Canadian or a national of a partner country that is listed in Annex 1 to the Restricted Goods and Technologies List, or a subsidiary of such an entity;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: civil aircraft registered in a foreign state that are departing from Canada after a temporary sojourn in Canada or civil aircraft registered in Canada departing for a temporary sojourn abroad;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the following goods, if stored on board an aircraft or ship:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: equipment and spare parts that are necessary for the proper operation of the aircraft or ship, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: usual and reasonable quantities of supplies intended for consumption on board the aircraft or ship during the outgoing and return flight or voyage;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: goods exported for use or consumption on an aircraft or ship that is registered in Canada or the United States;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: goods exported by an air carrier that is owned by a Canadian or a national of the United States for use in the maintenance, repair or operation of an aircraft registered in Canada or the United States;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: consumer communication devices that are generally available to the public and designed to be installed by the user without further substantial support; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: personal effects exported by an individual that are solely for the use of the individual or the individual’s immediate family and are not intended for sale or to remain in Russia unless consumed there.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) takes effect 60 days after it comes into force.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to provide to Russia or to any person in Russia a service referred to in Part 1 of Schedule 8 in relation to an industry referred to in Part 2 of that Schedule.

Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of the provision of a service referred to in any of items 1 to 28 of Part 1 of Schedule 8 in relation to an industry referred to in any of items 8 to 15 of Part 2 of that Schedule until 60 days after the day on which this subsection comes into force if the service is provided under a contract entered into before that coming into force.

Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of the provision of a service referred to in item 29 or 30 of Part 1 of Schedule 8 until 60 days after the day on which this subsection comes into force if the service is provided under a contract entered into before that coming into force.
It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to import, purchase or acquire any good referred to in column 1 of Schedule 9, from Russia or from any person in Russia.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: goods in transit through Russia from a third country; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: personal effects that are taken by an individual leaving Russia that are solely for the use of the individual or the individual’s immediate family.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) takes effect 30 days after it comes into force.

Section.Text: Section 3 does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any payment made by or on behalf of a designated person listed in Schedule 1 that is due under a contract entered into before the designated person was listed in that Schedule, provided that the payment is not made to or for the benefit of a designated person listed in that Schedule;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any benefit paid under the Old Age Security Act, the Canada Pension Plan or the Act respecting the Québec Pension Plan, CQLR, c. R-9, any superannuation, pension or benefit paid under or in respect of any retirement savings plan or retirement plan, any amount paid under or in respect of the Garnishment, Attachment and Pension Diversion Act or the Pension Benefits Division Act and any other amount paid in respect of disability to any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any transaction in respect of any account at a financial institution held by a diplomatic mission, if the transaction is required in order for the mission to fulfill its diplomatic functions as set out in Article 3 of the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations or, if the diplomatic mission has been temporarily or permanently recalled, when the transaction is required in order to maintain the mission premises;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any transaction to international organizations with diplomatic status, United Nations agencies, the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, or Canadian non-governmental organizations that have entered into a grant or contribution agreement with the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any transactions necessary for a Canadian to transfer to a person not listed in Schedule 1 any accounts, funds or investments of a Canadian held by a designated person listed in that schedule on the day on which that person was listed in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: financial services required in order for a designated person listed in Schedule 1 to obtain legal services in Canada with respect to the application of any of the prohibitions set out in these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any dealings with a designated person listed in Schedule 1 required with respect to loan repayments made to any person in Canada, or any Canadian outside Canada, for loans entered into with any person other than a designated person listed in Schedule 1 or with a designated person listed in that Schedule before the day on which that person was listed in that Schedule, and for enforcement or realization of security in respect of those loans, or payments by guarantors guaranteeing those loans.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to knowingly do anything that causes, facilitates or assists in, or is intended to cause, facilitate or assist in, any activity prohibited by sections 3 to 3.11.
Each of the following entities must determine on a continuing basis whether it is in possession or control of property owned or controlled by or on behalf of a designated person listed in Schedule 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: authorized foreign banks, as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act, in respect of their business in Canada or banks to which that Act applies;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: the Bank of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cooperative credit societies, savings and credit unions and caisses populaires regulated by a provincial Act and associations regulated by the Cooperative Credit Associations Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: foreign companies, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act, in respect of their insurance business in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: companies, provincial companies and societies, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: fraternal benefit societies regulated by a provincial Act in respect of their insurance activities and insurance companies and other entities engaged in the business of insuring risks that are regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: companies to which the Trust and Loan Companies Act applies;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: trust companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: loan companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: entities that engage in any activity described in paragraph 5(h) of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act, if the activity involves the opening of an account for a client; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: entities authorized under provincial legislation to engage in the business of dealing in securities, or to provide portfolio management or investment counselling services.

Subsection.Text: Every person in Canada and every Canadian outside Canada must disclose without delay to the Commissioner of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the existence of property in their possession or control that they have reason to believe is owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by a designated person listed in Schedule 1 or by an entity owned or controlled by a designated person listed in that Schedule; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information about a transaction or proposed transaction in respect of property referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: No proceedings under the Special Economic Measures Act and no civil proceedings lie against a person for a disclosure made in good faith under subsection (1).

Section.MarginalNote: Application to no longer be designated person

Subsection.Text: A designated person may apply in writing to the Minister to have their name removed from Schedule 1, 2 or 3.
On receipt of the application, the Minister must decide whether there are reasonable grounds to recommend to the Governor in Council that the applicant’s name be removed from Schedule 1, 2 or 3.
The Minister must make a decision on the application within 90 days after the day on which the application is received.
The Minister must give notice without delay to the applicant of the decision taken.
If there has been a material change in circumstances since the last application was submitted, a person may submit another application under subsection (1).
A person claiming not to be a designated person may apply to the Minister for a certificate stating that they are not the person who has been designated under either section 2 or 2.1
If it is established that the person is not a designated person, the Minister must issue a certificate to the applicant within 30 days after the day on which the application is received.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Provision.Text: In this Schedule, development, electronic assembly, energetic material, production, required, software and use have the same meaning as under the heading “Definitions of Terms Used in Groups 1 And 2” of A Guide to Canada’s Export Control List, published by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development, as amended from time to time.

This Schedule does not apply to goods or technologies that are subject to export control under the Export Control List, unless the good or technology is described in item 5400 of Group 5 of the schedule to that List.

row.entry: Column 1
Item
Goods and Technologies

Equipment, electronic assemblies and components, specially designed for quantum computers1, quantum electronics, quantum sensors, quantum processing units, qubit circuits, qubit devices2 or quantum radar systems.

Provision.Text: Cryogenic refrigeration systems3 designed to maintain temperatures below 1.1 kelvin for 48 hours or more and cryogenic refrigeration equipment and components therefor, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: pulse tubes;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: cryostats;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: dewars;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: gas handling systems;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: compressors; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: control units.
Ultra-high vacuum (UHV)4 equipment, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: UHV sublimation, turbomolecular, diffusion, cryogenic, or ion-getter pumps; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: UHV pressure gauges.

row.entry: High quantum efficiency photodetectors with a quantum efficiency greater than 80% in the wavelength range exceeding 300 nanometres but not exceeding 1700 nanometres.

Provision.Text: Manufacturing equipment, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: additive manufacturing equipment for the production of metal parts, as follows:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: powder-bed systems using selective laser melting, laser cladding, direct metal laser sintering or electron beam melting, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: powder-fed systems using laser cladding, direct energy deposition or laser metal deposition;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: additive manufacturing equipment for energetic materials, including equipment using ultrasonic extrusion; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: vat photopolymerization additive manufacturing equipment using stereo lithography or direct light processing.

row.entry: Metal powders and metal alloy powders usable for the additive manufacturing equipment referred to in Item 5(a).

Provision.Text: Microscopes, related equipment and detectors, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: scanning electron microscopes;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: scanning auger microscopes;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: transmission electron microscopes;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: atomic force microscopes;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: scanning force microscopes; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: equipment and detectors specially designed for use with the microscopes referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e), employing any of the following:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: x-ray photo spectroscopy,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: energy-dispersive x-ray spectroscopy,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: electron back scatter detector systems, or

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: electron spectroscopy for chemical analysis.

row.entry: Decapsulation5 equipment for semiconductor devices.
Software specially designed or modified for the development, production or use of the systems, equipment and components referred to in Items 1 to 8.
Software for digital twins of additive manufactured products or for the determination of the reliability of additive manufactured products.
Technology required for the development, production or use of the systems, equipment, components or software referred to in Items 1 to 10.

Footnote.Text: Quantum computers perform computations that harness the collective properties of quantum states, such as superposition, interference and entanglement.

The units, circuits and devices referred to in this Item include those that use or are based on superconducting circuits, quantum annealing, ion traps, photonic interaction, silicon spin qubits and cold atoms.
Cryogenic refrigeration systems include dilution refrigeration systems, adiabatic demagnetization refrigerators and laser cooling systems.
Decapsulation means the removal of a cap, lid, or encapsulating material from a packaged integrated circuit by mechanical, thermal or chemical methods.
